*

Rabbit

Aug 12, 2010

Montano was growing weary of the chase through the sculpture garden. It had been great fun at first, with the white rabbit eagerly scampering after him as he would run away and hide, but he was tired now. As he stopped to catch his breath under the purple evening sky, the rabbit caught up to him and began jumping around him, eager for him to run yet again. Montano had stopped near the edge of a large precipice, which gave him an idea. Montano and the rabbit lined up facing the sharp drop of the cliff. “O.K. Now it’s a race to see who is the fastest,” he explained to the rabbit. “Ready…GO!” They both ran forward, but Montano only took a step before stopping. He watched as the rabbit tumbled far down the cliff, satisfied with his solution. As he turned to leave, the rabbit hopped back up the cliff in a single bound and began running after him again.
